title: [VID] 2026-02-10_14-21-15.mkv
content:
Time Range	Error Type	Original Text	Suggested Correction	Localized Reasoning/Explanation
00:02	Capitalization	obtain	Obtain	Button labels should follow Title Case for consistency and a professional UI appearance.
00:03	Diction/Consistency	Meteorite Number+2	Meteorite Count +2	"Number" is vague in this context. "Count" or "Amount" more accurately describes an increase in the quantity of projectiles.
00:40	Grammar	Bond Skill Selection	Bond Skill Selection	Header is fine, but ensure "Bond" matches your internal glossary if "Traits" or "Synergy" was preferred (currently not in provided glossary).
00:41	Grammar	Each Defense Tower additionally summons a Focused Laser with 25% damage	Each Defense Tower summons an additional Focused Laser dealing 25% DMG.	Phrasing is a bit wordy. "DMG" is the standard abbreviation for damage in most Western mobile games.
00:43	Grammar/Articles	Soldier has a 50% chance to release 50% damage lightning chain every 2 seconds	Soldiers have a 50% chance to release a lightning chain dealing 50% DMG every 2s.	Missing article "a". Plural "Soldiers" is more natural for a unit type description.
00:45	Diction/Style	Release an additional 1-hit Meteor, dealing damage and applying 30% Slow to targets within range	Release an additional Meteor strike that deals damage and slows targets by 30%.	"1-hit" is technical jargon that breaks immersion. "Strike" is more thematic.
00:56	Punctuation/Style	Click or move to the Circle Position to build a City Wall Lv.1	Click or move to the circle to build a City Wall (Lv. 1).	Missing a period. "Circle Position" is unnecessarily capitalized and redundant.
00:58	Conciseness	Block the ground enemies' attack	Blocks ground attacks	Building descriptions should be concise. "Ground enemies' attack" is clunky.
01:00	Grammar/Logic	Click Build to build City Walls.	Tap "Build" to construct the wall.	Avoid repeating "build". Use quotes to distinguish UI elements from instructions.
01:04	Punctuation	Monsters are coming!	WARNING: Monsters Incoming!	"Incoming" or "Approaching" is more standard for wave-based survival games.
01:25	Grammar/Capitals	Release a lightning Chain that can bounce 2 times, dealing Lightning damage to enemies in its path	Releases a lightning chain that bounces up to 2 times, dealing Lightning DMG to enemies in its path.	"Chain" should not be capitalized mid-sentence.
01:27	Conciseness	Meteorite Damage increased, Quantity +3	Meteorite DMG +X%, Count +3	Mixing a status ("increased") with a math symbol ("+3") looks inconsistent. Use math symbols for both if possible.
01:29	Grammar	Fire a laser to lock the enemy for 4s, dealing energy DMG.	Fires a laser that locks onto enemies for 4s, dealing energy DMG.	"Fire" should be "Fires" to match the third-person descriptive style of other skills.
01:53	Diction	Boss incoming!	BOSS APPROACHING!	A bit more impactful for a boss reveal.
02:00	Punctuation	Team Skill Cooldown - 5%	Team Skill Cooldown: -5%	Use a colon to separate the attribute name from its modifier value for better readability.
03:07	Diction	DMG Tally	Damage Report	"Tally" is slightly informal; "Report" or "Summary" is more common for post-match statistics.
03:10	Conciseness	Detailed Damage	Details	Standard UI practice: shorter button labels prevent text overflow in other languages (e.g., German/Russian).
04:55	Structure	New System Unlocked Building Supply	New System Unlocked: Building Supply	Needs a colon to separate the notification from the name of the new system.
04:59	Grammar/Voice	Guaranteed to obtain a Superior Building every 20 draws	Superior Building guaranteed every 20 draws.	Passive voice or shortened phrases are more natural for gacha/draw rules.
05:04	Redundancy	Successfully received the following rewards:	Rewards received:	"Successfully received" is "translationese" (literal translation of æˆåŠŸè·å¾—). "Rewards received" is cleaner.
05:07	Grammar	Train 4 infantry, strong survivability, dealing single-target damage	Trains 4 infantry units with high survivability and single-target damage.	The building "trains" units. The list of attributes should flow logically.
05:13	Standardization	Every 10 seconds, infantry gains 1-time Damage Shield for 2 seconds, damage - 10%	Every 10s, infantry gain a one-time Damage Shield for 2s (Damage Taken -10%).	"damage - 10%" is ambiguous. Does it mean the shield reduces damage taken, or the unit deals less damage? Context implies reduction.
05:14	Data Consistency	Infantry DR +21%	Infantry DR +2.1%	Likely a decimal error in the localization file. A jump from 2% to 21% for a single level is statistically improbable in this genre.
05:39	Diction/Flavor	Butcher Zombie	Zombie Butcher	Standard noun-adjective order in English titles. "Butcher Zombie" sounds like a zombie that is a butcher, "Zombie Butcher" sounds more like a specific boss type.
08:50	Style/Consistency	Awaken-LightningChain	Awakened: Lightning Chain	Missing spaces. "Awakened" is the standard past participle used for upgraded skills.
09:01	Capitalization	machine gun turret lv.1	Machine Gun Turret Lv. 1	Entities and proper names must be capitalized.
10:02	Truncation	Flying into the air can bypass city walls and...	Flying units bypass walls.	Text is cut off in the UI. Shorten the text significantly to fit the bubble.
11:53	Terminology	Normal Helmet	Common Helmet	In RPG/Loot systems, the lowest tier is almost always "Common," not "Normal."
11:59	Severe Mistranslation	Bounce and Split Purchase to get an awesome Level Chest	Limited Offer: Level Chest Bundle!	"Bounce and Split Purchase" is a nonsensical literal translation of a Chinese marketing term (likely å¼¹çª—/åˆ†æœŸ or similar). It needs a complete rewrite for Western markets.

title: [VID] 2026-02-13_17-42-35.mp4
content:
Time	Location	âš ï¸ Issue Type (English)	âŒ Original Text	âœ… Better English	ğŸ’¡ Deep Analysis (English)
0:02	Gear Screen - Machine Icon	Terminology Consistency	Recycle	Salvage	The text on the machine graphic says "Recycle," but the primary action button below it says "Salvage." Using two different terms for the same mechanic causes player confusion. Standardize to "Salvage."
0:04	Gear Screen - Lock Message	Punctuation & Spacing	Activation needs:Create character for 4days	Requires: Create character for 4 days	There is a missing space after the colon and a missing space between "4" and "days." "Activation needs" is a literal translation of "æ¿€æ´»éœ€è¦" and sounds unnatural; "Requires" is the native gaming standard.
0:04	Gear Screen - Lock Message	Grammar	Clear Chapter 10	Clear Chapter 10	While technically correct, there should be a consistent delimiter or bullet point if listing multiple requirements to improve readability.
0:07	Gear Screen - Filter Menu	Terminology	Clothes	Armor	In a survival/combat context, "Clothes" sounds too mundane. "Armor," "Top," or "Chest" is the industry standard for gear equipped to the torso.
0:07	Gear Screen - Filter Menu	Terminology	Shoes	Boots	"Shoes" sounds like civilian footwear. "Boots" or "Footwear" carries a more tactical, combat-ready tone suitable for the game's theme.
0:09	Salvage Screen - Header	Syntax/Grammar	Equip Salvage	Salvage Equipment	"Equip Salvage" is confusing as it sounds like an instruction to "equip" a "salvage" item. "Salvage Equipment" or "Equipment Salvage" clarifies that the screen is for the destruction/recycling of gear.
0:09	Salvage Screen - Filter	Capitalization	normal and below	Normal and below	"Normal" refers to a specific rarity tier (White). All rarity tiers should be capitalized as Proper Nouns to distinguish them from common adjectives.
0:11	Stats Details - Content	Punctuation Consistency	Bravado!	Bravado	Stat names (ATK, DEF, etc.) should not include punctuation. The exclamation mark after "Bravado" is inconsistent with the rest of the list and looks like a typo rather than a feature.
0:14	Building Supply - Gacha	Logic & Grammar	Guaranteed: Building is draw(s)	Guaranteed Building in: {n} draw(s)	The current phrasing is broken. It likely means to show a countdown until a guaranteed drop. "Building is draw(s)" makes no semantic sense in English.
0:19	Main Menu - Top Button	Terminology (Chinglish)	Welfare	Rewards / Events	"Welfare" (ç¦åˆ©) is a classic mistranslation. In English, "Welfare" refers to government social assistance for the poor. Native speakers expect "Rewards," "Benefits," or "Bonus."
0:19	Main Menu - Mission Text	Grammar (Article usage)	Clear the Main Chapter 3	Clear Main Chapter 3	Including "the" is grammatically acceptable but creates unnecessary visual bulk in a UI element. Removing "the" makes the instruction punchier.
0:19	Main Menu - Stage Title	Redundancy	3:Despair Wasteland III	Chapter 3: Despair Wasteland	The number "3" is used twice (once as a digit and once as a Roman numeral). This is redundant. Use one format for the chapter count.
0:22	Skill Screen - Tabs	Capitalization Consistency	gene	Gene	The "Skills" tab starts with a capital letter, but the "gene" tab is lowercase. UI elements must maintain consistent capitalization; "Gene" should be capitalized.
0:22	Skill Screen - Empty State	Grammar	No stats bonus currently	No current stat bonuses	"Stats bonus" is slightly clunky. Moving "current" to the front and pluralizing the object ("stat bonuses") results in a much smoother, native-sounding sentence.
0:26	Skill Popup - Body Text	Terminology	promote various skills	upgrade various skills	"Promote" is a literal translation of "æå‡" (often used for ranking up). In the context of skill levels, "Upgrade" or "Level up" is the universally accepted terminology.
0:26	Skill Popup - Body Text	Wordiness	as much as possible	to maximize power	"As much as possible" is filler text that doesn't provide value. Use a phrase that explains the "Why," such as "to maximize your power" or "to gain bonuses."
0:29	Base Screen - Building	Terminology	Survivor Warehouse	Survivor Quarters	A "Warehouse" is for inanimate objects. If the building houses people, "Quarters," "Barracks," or "Shelter" is more appropriate and immersive.
0:31	Skill Screen - Lock Message	Punctuation & Spacing	Activation needs:Clear Chapter 10	Requires: Clear Chapter 10	Identical spacing error as seen at 0:04. Ensure a space follows every colon in the UI to prevent the text from looking cramped.
